title: Cat. 90  Candelabra, 1934
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Peer Smed (American, born Denmark, 1878–1943)  
Brooklyn, New York  
Silver; 47.3 × 28.6 cm (18 5/8 × 11 1/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Wesley M. Dixon, Jr., and Albert Pick, Jr., funds, 1989.516.1–2

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 90.1)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Sotheby’s (1989b), lot 11 (ill.).

With Firestone and Parson, Boston, by 198.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1989.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">New York, American Craft Museum, Craft in the Machine Age, 1920–1945: The History of Twentieth-Century American Craft, October 18, 1995–February 25, 1996, p. 128 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Kardon (1995), p. 129 (ill.).

Downs (2001), pp. 57–58, cat. 15 (ill.).

Barter et al. (2009a), pp. 218–20, cat. 100 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Candelabra, 1934.

fig. 90.1 </section>
